chapter.title: Imagery
chapter.para: Because radar and satellite images tend to come in shorter time intervals than depictions, the Imagery Control menu contains its own time control. (see ) The slider-bar at the top of the display allows the user to step through each time for which there is an image (from the selected products) to view. This control does not affect the depiction time.

orderedlist.title: To step through images in order:

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the
Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears. (see )
Move the slider in the slider-bar. (see )

sect1.title: Image Select
sect1.para: The Image Select tab controls selection of Satellite, Radar and data imagery to display, based on parameters set in the Image configuration file. (see ) Gridded date can be displayed as imagery either under or over satellite and radar. This is desirable when the gridded data is not well represented by B-spline interpolation. The gridded data cannot be edited but it can be sampled and included in graphical products.

orderedlist.title: To display a data grid as imagery under satellite and radar:

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the
Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears. (see )
Choose a data underlay product from the drop-down list.
Select data underlay sources from the list. (see )
Note that multiple data underlay images can be displayed at the same time. The image nearest to the top of the list is displayed on top of the others.
Choose an Enhancement colour scheme for the underlay images from the drop-down list.

Choose ImagerySelect or click the
Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears. (see )
Choose a satellite product from the drop-down list.
Select satellite sources from the list. (see )
Note that multiple satellite images can be displayed at the same time. The image nearest to the top of the list is displayed on top of the others.
Choose an Enhancement colour scheme for the satellite images from the drop-down list.

Choose ImagerySelect or click the
Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears. (see )
Choose a radar product from the drop-down list.
Select the radar sites from the list. (see )
Note that multiple radar images can be displayed at the same time. The image nearest to the top of the list is displayed on top of the others.
Choose an Enhancement colour scheme for the radar images from the drop-down list.

orderedlist.title: To display a data grid as imagery over satellite and radar:

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the
Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears. (see )
Choose a data overlay product from the drop-down list.
Select data overlay sources from the list. (see )
Note that multiple data overlay images can be displayed at the same time. The image nearest to the top of the list is displayed on top of the others.
Choose an Enhancement colour scheme for the overlay images from the drop-down list.

sect1.title: Image Options
sect1.para: The Image Options tab controls the brightness, blending ratio (making the Radar imagery semi-transparent), and time window for displaying imagery. The display of radar range rings can also be set. (see )

sect2.title: View Menu
sect2.para:
Some options can be turned on or off. They are located in the View menu.
ViewDepiction Sync
Synchronize the images with the depictions.
ViewUse Time Window
Use the time window specified in the Image Options tab when synchronizing with depictions. (see .)
ViewBlend Images
Blend the satellite and radar images using the ratio specified in the Image Options tab. (see .)
ViewApply Brightness
Apply the brightness factor specified in the Image Options tab. (see .)
ViewShow Colour Table
Show the colour tables associated with the selected Enhancement.
ViewRadar data view
If your radar images do not already contain range rings, they can be added using the Radar Data View options.
No Range Rings
Do not display range rings.
Limit Ring Only
Display a ring which displays the limit of the radar range only.
All Rings
Display the limit ring as well as rings spaced according to the value set in ViewSpacing (Km).

orderedlist.title: To adjust the brightness of radar images:

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears.
Select the Options tab. (see )
Move the slider for the Rad slider-bar to the right to increase brightness, to the left to decrease brightness. (see )

orderedlist.title: To adjust the brightness of satellite images:

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears.
Select the Options tab. (see )
Move the slider for the Sat slider-bar to the right to increase brightness, to the left to decrease brightness. (see )

sect2.title: Blending Ratio
sect2.para: When satellite and radar are displayed together they are "blended" to display a single image. The radar appears over the satellite image, obscuring the satellite information below. You can adjust the opacity of the radar so that you can see some satellite data through the radar data.

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears.
Select the Options tab. (see )

Move the slider in the slide-bar to the left to decrease the opacity of the radar (making the radar imagery semi-transparent), and move the slider to the right to increase the opacity of the radar. (see )

sect2.title: Time Window
sect2.para: depictionsequence The times associated with radar and satellite images will not usually match up exactly with the depiction times or with each other. Also sometimes a radar or satellite image may be missing for a particular time. However, you can step through the depiction sequence and have the nearest image (in time) displayed if one exists within a specified window. The window is specified in (negative) minutes before the depiction and (positive) minutes after the depiction.

orderedlist.title: To adjust the radar time window:

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears.
Select the Options tab. (see )
Adjust the Rad spin-boxes using the up and down arrows.

orderedlist.title: To adjust the satellite time window:

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears.
Select the Options tab. (see )
Adjust the Sat spin-boxes using the up and down arrows.

sect1.title: Image Animation
sect1.para: The Image Animation tab controls animation loops for imagery, independent of the depictions. (see ) (Note that moving through the depictions will display matching radar and satellite data depending on the time window set with Image Options, but may not display all the radar or satellite imagery that is available between the depictions.)

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears.
Select images to animate. (see )
Select the Animate tab. (see )
Set the Animation Window (see ).
Set the Speed of the animation (see ).
Click Start.
Click Stop.

sect2.title: Animation Window
sect2.para: It is possible to accumulate a large number radar and satellite images over the course of a day. Sometimes you want to animate only a few hours of imagery. This can be done using the Animation Window slider bar.

orderedlist.title: To limit the animation to a subset of the available images:

listitem.para: Move the left-hand slider to the desired start time. (see )
Move the right-hand slider to the desired end time. (see )

sect2.title: Animation Speed
sect2.para: You may adjust the speed of the animation by moving the slider in the Speed slider-bar left to slow the animation or right to speed it up. (see )

sect1.title: Image Sampling
sect1.para: The Image Sampling tab controls sampling data type imagery. (see )
You can add temporary labels to the &FPA; window with the Sample tool, as you can with continuous fields.

listitem.para:
Choose ImagerySelect or click the Image Select
icon in the "Command Icon Bar".
The Image Control dialog box appears.
Select the Sample tab. (see )
Select an image to sample from the Site list.
Select a type of sample from the Value list.
Select the display: colour, size and font from the Attributes section.
Pick a point on the depiction. (Point should be within the range of the site chosen)
A temporary label appears.
You can sample as many points as you want.
Click the &right; mouse button and select Clear to clear the labels from the depiction.
